document_data.name: House of St. Liwan's Blessing
document_data.mainbody:
The '''House of St. Liwan's Blessing''' was a [[monastery]] of [[Ilmater]] on the western coast of [[Calimshan]].

{{Quote|For who can war on a full stomach when the body itself suggests peace?|[[St. Liwan]], regarding how food and good diet can lead to peace and an end of suffering}}
document_data.Location: This monastery was located high on the cliffs along the northern stretch of the [[Coast Trail]] from [[Teshburl]] to [[Memnon]].
document_data.Structure: The House was a former [[caravanserai]], like many of the monasteries in Calimshan.
document_data.Activities: In addition to religious activities, the House of St. Liwan's Blessing served as a culinary arts school—from exotic food to shipboard fare. Its patron saint, [[St. Liwan]], believed that food could end suffering.
document_data.Inhabitants: In [[1370 DR]], the head abbot was Revered Father [[Akkabar el Souvlak]].<ref>
